display_name: Child Self-Report: Calculated - Psychosocial Health Summary Score
description:
The psychosocial health summary score is the sum of items answered in the emotional, social, and school functioning subscale score from the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory (PedsQL). A high score suggests better psychosocial health. [Varni, Seid, and Rode 1999 (PubMed ID: 10024117)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/10024117/)

[Search for all PedsQL variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/pats/variables?search=pedsql)
